card.name: Abduction
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When Abduction enters the battlefield, untap enchanted creature.
You control enchanted creature.
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Abduction may be cast targeting an untapped creature.

card.name: Abeyance
card.ability:
Until end of turn, target player can't cast instant or sorcery spells, and that player can't activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"I'm too modest a wizard to reveal the full extent of my abilities."
—Ertai, wizard adept
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Abeyance prohibits the activated abilities of cards which are not on the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : Abeyance never prevents mana abilities from being activated.
10/4/2004 : Abeyance does not affect abilities which are not activated, such as static abilities of cards and triggered abilities. It also doesn't stop the declaration of attackers or blockers.
8/1/2008 : This can't be used as a counterspell. It will have no effect on spells which were on the stack when it was cast, nor on those cast in response to it.

card.name: Abjure
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Abjure, sacrifice a blue permanent.
Counter target spell.
card.flavor: Mirri's hackles rose as Ertai continued expounding his virtues. "If that arrogant brat doesn't shut up soon," she growled to herself, "I'm going to have to kill him."
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : You can't sacrifice more than one permanent.

card.name: Aboroth
card.ability: Cumulative upkeep—Put a -1/-1 counter on Aboroth. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
card.flavor: The Weatherlight banked sharply as the colossal beast rose up to crush the lone rider. "My bet's on the dirt," Gerrard said flatly.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

card.name: Abyssal Gatekeeper
card.ability: When Abyssal Gatekeeper dies, each player sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor:
"There are two ways for me to pass this gate. One involves you remaining conscious."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The "sacrifice a creature" effect is not targeted. It can affect creatures with protection from black.
4/1/2008 : The player whose turn it is chooses a creature to sacrifice, then each other player in turn order chooses a creature to sacrifice, then all chosen creatures are sacrificed at the same time.

card.name: Æther Flash
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, Æther Flash deals 2 damage to it.
card.flavor:
"You can't get there from here. Well, you can—it just won't be fun."
—Ertai, wizard adept
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is not a targeted ability, so it deals damage to creatures that can't be targeted by spells and abilities.

card.name: Agonizing Memories
card.ability: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.
card.flavor:
"An innocent man died because of my anger. That knowledge will haunt me for all eternity."
—Karn, silver golem

card.name: Alabaster Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
When Alabaster Dragon dies, shuffle it into its owner's library.
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : This will always be shuffled into its owner’s library.

card.name: Alms
card.ability: {1}, Exile the top card of your graveyard: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
card.flavor:
"Helping people is mostly a matter of teaching them to help themselves."
—Sisay, journal
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : The “top” card of your graveyard is the card that was put there most recently.
4/1/2008 : Players may not rearrange the cards in their graveyards. This is a little-known rule because new cards that care about graveyard order haven’t been printed in years.
4/1/2008 : If an effect or rule puts two or more cards into the same graveyard at the same time, the owner of those cards may arrange them in any order.
4/1/2008 : The last thing that happens to a resolving instant or sorcery spell is that it’s put into its owner’s graveyard. --Example: You cast Wrath of God. All creatures on the battlefield are destroyed. You arrange all the cards put into your graveyard this way in any order you want. The other players in the game do the same to the cards that are put into their graveyards. Then you put Wrath of God into your graveyard, on top of the other cards.
4/1/2008 : Say you’re the owner of both a permanent and an Aura that’s attached to it. If both the permanent and the Aura are destroyed at the same time (by Akroma’s Vengeance, for example), you decide the order they’re put into your graveyard. If just the enchanted permanent is destroyed, it’s put into your graveyard first. Then, after state-based actions are checked, the Aura (which is no longer attached to anything) is put into your graveyard on top of it.

card.name: Ancestral Knowledge
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When Ancestral Knowledge enters the battlefield, look at the top ten cards of your library, then exile any number of them and put the rest back on top of your library in any order.
When Ancestral Knowledge leaves the battlefield, shuffle your library.

card.name: Angelic Renewal
card.ability: Whenever a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may sacrifice Angelic Renewal. If you do, return that card to the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If multiple creatures go to the graveyard at once, Angelic Renewal triggers multiple times, but it can only be sacrificed once and only brings back one creature.
10/4/2004 : If this card goes to the graveyard at the same time as a creature or sometime between when the creature left the battlefield and when the triggered ability resolves, then you will not be able to sacrifice this card and the creature can't be returned to the battlefield.
4/1/2008 : If an animated permanent that’s not normally a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, Angelic Renewal can return that card to the battlefield.
4/1/2008 : If a token creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you can sacrifice Angelic Renewal, but nothing will be returned to the battlefield.

card.name: Apathy
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may discard a card at random. If he or she does, untap that creature.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : The player may discard a card at random whether the enchanted creature is tapped or not

card.name: Arctic Wolves
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When Arctic Wolves enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor:
"No matter where we cat warriors go in the world, those stupid slobberers find us."

card.name: Ardent Militia
card.ability: Vigilance
card.flavor:
"While the rest of us got paid to serve the Benalish army, the militia didn't. I used to say they stood for freedom—free and dumb."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Argivian Find
card.ability: Return target artifact or enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor:
"We often bury our pasts, and then someone comes along and digs them up."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Argivian Restoration
card.ability: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"The Argivian University taught me two things: always look to the past, and never dismiss what appears useless."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Aura of Silence
card.ability:
Artifact and enchantment spells your opponents cast cost {2} more to cast.
Sacrifice Aura of Silence: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Aura of Silence affects all opponents in a multiplayer game.

card.name: Avizoa
card.ability:
Flying
{0}: Avizoa gets +2/+2 until end of turn. You skip your next untap step. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: "Maybe we can trap them with bait," thought Tahngarth, eyeing Squee.

card.name: Barishi
card.ability: When Barishi dies, exile Barishi, then shuffle all creature cards from your graveyard into your library.
card.ruling:

card.name: Barrow Ghoul
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Barrow Ghoul unless you exile the top creature card of your graveyard.
card.flavor:
"They killed my family to deny me a future. They fed on my ancestors to deny me a past."
—Crovax

card.name: Benalish Infantry
card.ability: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor:
"My favorite part of getting into the infantry was getting out again."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Benalish Knight
card.ability:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
card.flavor:
"We called them ‘armored lightning.'"
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Benalish Missionary
card.ability: {1}{W}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target blocked creature this turn.
card.flavor:
"These horn-haters say no gods but theirs exist. I say let him find out for himself—right now"
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Works even if the creature is "blocked" by an effect rather than actual creatures.

card.name: Betrothed of Fire
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Sacrifice an untapped creature: Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
Sacrifice enchanted creature: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : If you control Betrothed of Fire, but it’s attached to a creature you don’t control, no one can activate the last ability. The creature’s controller can’t activate it because that player doesn’t control the Aura. You can’t activate it because you can’t pay the cost -- you can’t sacrifice a creature you don’t control.

card.name: Bloodrock Cyclops
card.ability: Bloodrock Cyclops attacks each turn if able.
card.flavor:
"He's big an' dumb an' ready to fight. A lot like ol' Hornhead here."
—Squee, goblin cabin hand,
scouting report
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : There is no penalty if it can't attack.

card.name: Blossoming Wreath
card.ability: You gain life equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
card.flavor:
"I place this wreath for you, my kin. Even in death, you give me strength to avenge you."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Creatures are counted on resolution.

card.name: Bogardan Firefiend
card.ability: When Bogardan Firefiend dies, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
card.flavor:
"The next one who tells me to relax and curl up by a fire is dead."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You must pick a target creature, even if you are the only player with creatures on the battlefield.

card.name: Boiling Blood
card.ability:
Target creature attacks this turn if able.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
Your father has no horns
Your mother wears a bell
You drink the milk of goats
—Talruum taunts

card.name: Bösium Strip
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Until end of turn, if the top card of your graveyard is an instant or sorcery card, you may cast that card. If a card cast this way would be put into a graveyard this turn, exile it instead.

card.name: Briar Shield
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Sacrifice Briar Shield: Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: In all its forms, the forest is the elves' best protector.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : When you cast Briar Shield’s activated ability, Briar Shield is put into the graveyard as a cost. The +1/+1 effect immediately ends, but the +3/+3 effect won’t begin until the ability resolves. The enchanted creature gets no bonus while Briar Shield’s ability is on the stack. If its toughness is 0 during this time, it’ll be put into the graveyard.

card.name: Bubble Matrix
card.ability: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures.
card.flavor:
"This device was commisioned by a king who desired peace. Unfortunately, the royal artificer was also the king's jester."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Buried Alive
card.ability: Search your library for up to three creature cards and put them into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor:
"Is it worse to walk while dead, or to be buried alive? I have witnessed both."
—Crovax
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can look in your library and then choose to find any number from zero to three creatures after you look at it.

card.name: Call of the Wild
card.ability: {2}{G}{G}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
card.flavor: Thinking of dinner made Squee realize that the forest was probably thinking the same thing.

card.name: Chimeric Sphere
card.ability:
{2}: Until end of turn, Chimeric Sphere becomes a 2/1 Construct artifact creature with flying.
{2}: Until end of turn, Chimeric Sphere becomes a 3/2 Construct artifact creature without flying.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If the first ability is activated and resolves, then the second ability is activated and resolves, Chimeric Sphere will be a 3/2 creature. It won’t have flying.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Choking Vines
card.ability:
Cast Choking Vines only during the declare blockers step.
X target attacking creatures become blocked. Choking Vines deals 1 damage to each of those creatures. (This spell works on unblockable creatures.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Choking Vines will make any creatures it targets become blocked, even if the creature had blocking restrictions on it. For example, you can make a creature with Islandwalk become blocked even if the defending player has Islands. This is because evasion abilities only prevent creatures from being assigned to block them.
10/4/2004 : You can declare zero targets, with X=0.
4/1/2008 : Choking Vines isn't particularly effective against creatures with trample. Since the creature with trample has no blocker to assign damage to, all the damage will be assigned to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : You may target a blocked creature with Choking Vines. Choking Vines will deal 1 damage to it, and have no other effect on it.
4/1/2008 : If a previously unblocked creature becomes blocked as a result of Choking Vines, any “When this creature becomes blocked” abilities that creature has will trigger. Any “When this creature becomes blocked by a creature” abilities that creature has won’t trigger.

card.name: Cinder Giant
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, Cinder Giant deals 2 damage to each other creature you control.
card.flavor:
"The giant wept tears of embers for the deaths of his allies."
—Azeworai, "The Lonely Giant"

card.name: Cinder Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Cinder Wall blocks, destroy it at end of combat.
card.flavor:

—Squee, goblin cabin hand,
scouting report

card.name: Cloud Djinn
card.ability:
Flying
Cloud Djinn can block only creatures with flying.
card.flavor:
As elusive as the footprint of a djinn
—Suq'Ata expression

card.name: Coils of the Medusa
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/-1.
Sacrifice Coils of the Medusa: Destroy all non-Wall creatures blocking enchanted creature.
card.flavor: Serpentine locks shape ornate rocks.

card.name: Cone of Flame
card.ability: Cone of Flame deals 1 damage to target creature or player, 2 damage to another target creature or player, and 3 damage to a third target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Mine is not the warmth of compassion."
—Ertai, wizard adept
card.ruling: 7/15/2007 : You can't choose the same target more than once. If there aren't three different legal targets available, you can't cast the spell.

card.name: Debt of Loyalty
card.ability: Regenerate target creature. You gain control of that creature if it regenerates this way.
card.flavor: "I killed him because I had to," Starke lied to Gerrard. "But now I pledge my loyalty to you."
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : Casting Debt of Loyalty puts a regeneration shield on a creature. If, later in the turn, that creature would be destroyed, instead it regenerates and you gain control of it. Note that it will be tapped when you gain control of it. The control change has no duration; you’ll retain control of that creature until the game ends or until some other effect causes it to change control.
4/1/2008 : If you cast Debt of Loyalty but nothing happens to the targeted creature for the rest of the turn that would cause it to be destroyed, Debt of Loyalty has no visible effect. The regeneration shield wears off at the end of the turn. If the creature regenerates during a later turn, you won’t gain control of it.
4/1/2008 : If a creature has two regeneration shields on it -- one from a Debt of Loyalty you cast and one from another effect -- and it would be destroyed, its controller chooses which regeneration shield to use. If that player chooses to use the Debt of Loyalty shield, you’ll gain control of the creature. If the player chooses to use the other shield, you won’t gain control of the creature, but the Debt of Loyalty shield will remain on that creature for the rest of the turn (in case it would be destroyed again).
4/1/2008 : You may cast Debt of Loyalty targeting a creature you already control. If you do, and that creature would be destroyed later in the turn, it will regenerate and you’ll gain control of it (though gaining control of a creature you already control usually has no visible effect).
4/1/2008 : An indestructible creature never needs to regenerate, so Debt of Loyalty will have no effect on it.

card.name: Dense Foliage
card.ability: Creatures can't be the targets of spells.
card.flavor:
"Big plants not only good for hidin', but full o' tasty bugs, too."
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

card.name: Desperate Gambit
card.ability: Choose a source you control and flip a coin. If you win the flip, the next time that source would deal damage this turn, it deals double that damage instead. If you lose the flip, the next time it would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The coin is flipped during resolution of this spell, so you know in advance what will happen when the source deals damage the next time.
4/1/2008 : The chosen source may be a permanent, a spell on the stack, or anything referred to by something on the stack (such as a Prodigal Pyromancer that’s left the battlefield while its ability is still on the stack)

card.name: Dingus Staff
card.ability: Whenever a creature dies, Dingus Staff deals 2 damage to that creature's controller.
card.flavor:
"A sharp conscience is the weapon of the soul."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Disrupt
card.ability:
Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Oh, I'm sorry—did I break your concentration?
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : You draw a card regardless of whether the targeted spell was countered or {1} was paid.

card.name: Doomsday
card.ability: Search your library and graveyard for five cards and exile the rest. Put the chosen cards on top of your library in any order. You lose half your life, rounded up.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You lose the life during resolution.
4/1/2008 : If your graveyard and library combined contain five or more cards, you must choose five cards from among them. You can’t choose to find fewer than that.
4/1/2008 : If your graveyard and library combined contain fewer than five cards, all of those cards will wind up in your library.

card.name: Downdraft
card.ability:
{G}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.
Sacrifice Downdraft: Downdraft deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.

card.name: Duskrider Falcon
card.ability: Flying, protection from black
card.flavor:
"Seaborne ships have their dolphins to dance in their wakes; I have my duskriders."
—Sisay, journal

card.name: Dwarven Berserker
card.ability: Whenever Dwarven Berserker becomes blocked, it gets +3/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: "I may be small, but I can kick your butt."

card.name: Dwarven Thaumaturgist
card.ability: {T}: Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
card.ruling:
11/1/2005 : Note that the wording "Effects that alter the creature's power alter its toughness instead, and vice versa, this turn" has been removed.

card.name: Null Rod
card.ability: Activated abilities of artifacts can't be activated.
card.flavor:
Gerrard: "But it doesn't do anything"
Hanna: "No—it does nothing."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does affect mana abilities of artifacts.
10/4/2004 : Does not affect continuous abilities or triggered abilities.
4/1/2008 : This covers only artifacts that are on the battlefield.

card.name: Odylic Wraith
card.ability:
Swampwalk
Whenever Odylic Wraith deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
card.flavor: By the time you've seen it, you won't remember that you did.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : Odylic Wraith’s ability triggers when it deals any kind of damage to a player, not just when it deals combat damage.

card.name: Ophidian
card.ability: Whenever Ophidian attacks and isn't blocked, you may draw a card. If you do, Ophidian assigns no combat damage this turn.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. card.name: Orcish Settlers
card.ability: {X}{X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Orcish Settlers: Destroy X target lands.
card.flavor: They wouldn't know their house from a charred hole in the ground.

card.name: Paradigm Shift
card.ability: Exile all cards from your library. Then shuffle your graveyard into your library.
card.flavor:
"Barrin always said that reality is relative. ‘The world,' he cautioned, ‘is but pieces of one's perception.'"
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Peacekeeper
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Peacekeeper unless you pay {1}{W}.
Creatures can't attack.
card.flavor:
"I have always imagined my mother as such a woman, strong and wise."
—Sisay, journal
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : When the ability resolves, you choose whether to sacrifice the creature or perform the other action. If you can’t perform the other action, then you must sacrifice the creature.

4/1/2008 : Peacekeeper’s ability doesn’t cause the combat phase or the declare attackers step to be skipped.

card.name: Pendrell Mists
card.ability: All creatures have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature unless you pay {1}."
card.flavor: As insubstantial—and as insistent—as appetite.
card.ruling:

card.name: Phantom Warrior
card.ability: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.
card.flavor:
"Fishtails infest the water, and mists walk the land. Give me simple solid rock any day."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

card.name: Phantom Wings
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

card.name: Phyrexian Furnace
card.ability:
{T}: Exile the bottom card of target player's graveyard.
{1}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Furnace: Exile target card from a graveyard. Draw a card.

card.name: Psychic Vortex
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep—Draw a card. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice a land and discard your hand.
card.flavor:
"Tolaria floats upon a wheel of fortune."
—Ertai, wizard adept
card.ruling:

If enough of those draws are replaced by replacement effects so you don’t actually attempt to draw a card with an empty library, everything’s fine. However, if you do attempt to draw a card with an empty library this way, Psychic Vortex will remain on the battlefield but you’ll lose the game as a state-based action as soon as the cumulative upkeep ability finishes resolving.

card.name: Razortooth Rats
card.ability: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor:

card.name: Redwood Treefolk

card.name: Revered Unicorn

Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

card.name: Sage Owl

Flying

If Scorched Ruins would enter the battlefield, sacrifice two untapped lands instead. If you do, put Scorched Ruins onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {4} to your mana pool.

card.name: Serenity

card.flavor:

card.name: Serra's Blessing
card.ability: Creatures you control have vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)
card.flavor:

card.name: Shadow Rider

card.name: Shattered Crypt

card.name: Soul Shepherd

card.name: Southern Paladin
card.ability: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target red permanent.
card.flavor:

—The Book of Tal

card.name: Spinning Darkness
card.ability:
You may exile the top three black cards of your graveyard rather than pay Spinning Darkness's mana cost.
Spinning Darkness deals 3 damage to target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : The “top” card of your graveyard is the card that was put there most recently.
4/1/2008 : Players may not rearrange the cards in their graveyards. This is a little-known rule because new cards that care about graveyard order haven’t been printed in years.
4/1/2008 : If an effect or rule puts two or more cards into the same graveyard at the same time, the owner of those cards may arrange them in any order.
4/1/2008 : The last thing that happens to a resolving instant or sorcery spell is that it’s put into its owner’s graveyard. --Example: You cast Wrath of God. All creatures on the battlefield are destroyed. You arrange all the cards put into your graveyard this way in any order you want. The other players in the game do the same to the cards that are put into their graveyards. Then you put Wrath of God into your graveyard, on top of the other cards.
4/1/2008 : Say you’re the owner of both a permanent and an Aura that’s attached to it. If both the permanent and the Aura are destroyed at the same time (by Akroma’s Vengeance, for example), you decide the order they’re put into your graveyard. If just the enchanted permanent is destroyed, it’s put into your graveyard first. Then, after state-based actions are checked, the Aura (which is no longer attached to anything) is put into your graveyard on top of it.

card.name: Steel Golem
card.ability: You can't cast creature spells.

4/1/2008 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Strands of Night
card.ability: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a Swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

"I have seen the night torn into thin darkling strips and woven into shapes too bleak for dreams."

card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Striped Bears
card.ability: When Striped Bears enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor:
"The bear is never cautious—which is why it wasn't born a human."

card.name: Sylvan Hierophant

5/1/2007 : It targets a creature card in the graveyard. This target is selected when putting the triggered ability on the stack. The wording specifies it has to be a card other than the Hierophant
4/1/2008 : If you control Sylvan Hierophant when it goes to the graveyard, you exile the Hierophant and return a creature card from your graveyard to your hand. It doesn’t matter whose graveyard the Hierophant goes to.

card.name: Tariff
card.ability: Each player sacrifices the creature he or she controls with the highest converted mana cost unless he or she pays that creature's mana cost. If two or more creatures a player controls are tied for highest cost, that player chooses one.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The choice of creatures is made on resolution and not on announcement.
10/4/2004 : You can use mana abilities during the resolution of this spell if the player decides to pay the mana cost.
10/4/2004 : You choose whether to pay or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice the creature. You can choose to not pay if you control no creatures on resolution.
4/1/2008 : First the active player identifies the creature he or she controls with the highest mana cost (and chooses one if there’s a tie) and chooses whether to sacrifice it or pay mana. Then each other player in turn order does the same. All creatures sacrificed this way are sacrificed at the same time.
4/1/2008 : Although Tariff checks the converted mana cost of the creatures on the battlefield, you need to pay the creature’s actual mana cost (including color) to keep it on the battlefield.

card.name: Teferi's Veil
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control attacks, it phases out at end of combat. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
card.flavor:
"I don't like to speak ill of 'walkers . . . but just what did Teferi think he was doing?"
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Tendrils of Despair
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Tendrils of Despair, sacrifice a creature.
Target opponent discards two cards.
card.flavor:
"Because I am incapable of tears does not mean I have no need to shed them."
—Karn, silver golem
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the player has fewer than 2 cards, they discard whatever they have.
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Thran Forge
card.ability: {2}: Until end of turn, target nonartifact creature gets +1/+0 and becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.
card.flavor: "This will work," Gerrard called to the elves as he used the forge to strengthen the aboroth, "but if it doesn't, we won't survive to care."
card.ruling:
11/1/2005 : Now becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.
4/1/2008 : If Thran Forge’s ability is activated targeting a nonartifact creature, then it’s activated again in response targeting the same creature, the second instance will resolve. The first instance will then be countered for having an illegal target, since the target is no longer a nonartifact creature.

card.name: Thran Tome
card.ability: {5}, {T}: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Target opponent chooses one of those cards. Put that card into your graveyard, then draw two cards.
card.flavor: Every line holds a tale, and between lie a thousand more.
card.ruling:
10/15/2006 : It does not target the cards, but it targets the opponent. If you can’t target an opponent, you can’t activate this ability.
5/1/2007 : After the opponent chooses which card to put into your graveyard, you draw two cards regardless of how many were actually revealed or how many you have left in your library.

card.name: Thunderbolt
card.ability: Choose one — Thunderbolt deals 3 damage to target player; or Thunderbolt deals 4 damage to target creature with flying.
card.flavor:
"Most wizards consider a thunderbolt to be a proper retort."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Thundermare
card.ability:
Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
When Thundermare enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.
card.flavor: Its hooves strike lightning and the thunder follows quickly after.

card.name: Timid Drake
card.ability:
Flying
When another creature enters the battlefield, return Timid Drake to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"I sneezed, and it bolted."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Tolarian Drake
card.ability:
Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
card.flavor: Many have been lost just in staring at its wings. What's seen differs from account to account, but madness is always part of the story.

card.name: Tolarian Entrancer
card.ability: Whenever Tolarian Entrancer becomes blocked by a creature, gain control of that creature at end of combat.
card.flavor:
"Why should I boast? The bards will do it for me—and with music."
—Ertai, wizard adept
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : The control change has no duration; you’ll retain control of that creature until the game ends or until some other effect causes it to change control. It doesn’t matter if Tolarian Entrancer leaves the battlefield, or if Tolarian Entrancer has already left the battlefield by the time the “at end of combat” ability triggers.

card.name: Tolarian Serpent
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, put the top seven cards of your library into your graveyard.
card.flavor:
"When the fishtails' threats of magic didn't move me, they set their pet on us."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If less than seven cards in the library, move all that are there.

card.name: Touchstone
card.ability: {T}: Tap target artifact you don't control.
card.flavor:
"One touch to the stone and the sidar's son turned me from stalwart to statue."
—Karn, silver golem

card.name: Tranquil Grove
card.ability: {1}{G}{G}: Destroy all other enchantments.
card.flavor:

card.name: Uktabi Efreet
card.ability: Cumulative upkeep {G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

card.name: Urborg Justice
card.ability: Target opponent sacrifices a creature for each creature put into your graveyard from the battlefield this turn.
card.flavor:

card.ruling:

card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player controls a nonblack, nonland permanent, Urborg Stalker deals 1 damage to that player.
card.flavor:
"May you be a stalker's dream."
—Urborg curse
card.ruling:

card.name: Veteran Explorer
card.ability: When Veteran Explorer dies, each player may search his or her library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : The player whose turn it is searches his or her library (or chooses not to), then each other player in turn order does the same. Then the player whose turn it is shuffles his or her library (if that player searched), then each other player in turn order does the same.

card.name: Vitalize
card.ability: Untap all creatures you control.
card.flavor:
"After waking to the magic of Llanowar, no dreams can compare."

Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. "I'm always a little leery of anyone who offers to kill other people for free."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.

10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.

card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of your draw step, destroy each creature with converted mana cost equal to the number of age counters on Wave of Terror. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: The sea of fear has endless depths.
card.ruling:

4/1/2008 : This destroys creatures with converted mana cost exactly equal to the appropriate number, not equal to or less than that number.
4/1/2008 : If you don’t pay the cumulative upkeep, you’ll sacrifice Wave of Terror before your draw step begins. It won’t destroy any creatures that turn.

card.name: Well of Knowledge
card.ability: {2}: Draw a card. Any player may activate this ability but only during his or her draw step.

{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

card.ability: {5}: Until end of turn, Xanthic Statue becomes an 8/8 Golem artifact creature with trample.

—Karn, silver golem
